reviewText: Amazingly well-done first film by young documentarian, Jonathan Crawford.  He captures the sleepy character of Conway, Arkansas, punctuated by the hostility and prejudice shown to a pair of middle-aged gay men---long-time partners, who want to marry.
Not only a social commentary, but a great oral history of a love that has stood the test of time even in the face of hate.  A wonderful experience.
This dvd is very well done and discusses socially relevant issues.  This is a must have!!  Enjoy!!!
